content.transcript:
Food handlers suffering from certain illnesses must not handle food.

They must notify their supervisor who must exclude them from any work which would expose food to risks from pathogens.

Here's a list of illnesses. Identify those which need reporting.

Tick whether the listed illnesses require reporting or not.

This might be very painful, but it won’t result in food contamination.

No need to report.

This won’t be pleasant, but you can’t contaminate food with German measles.

No need to report.
You could easily contaminate food with bacteria if you have nasal discharges and are coughing or sneezing, this should be reported.
This should be reported straight away, you may be suffering from food poisoning and could easily contaminate food.
This needs reporting, you could be suffering from food poisoning and will be at risk of contaminating food.
This isn’t nice, but it doesn’t need reporting so long as you treat it and cover your hair, so that it cannot contaminate food.
You must make sure this is reported straight away, you could easily contaminate food with an infected cut.
You should let your supervisor know about this, so that they can take the appropriate action.
This needs reporting so that medical decisions can be made as to whether it could be a problem.

page.statement: Ill whilst abroad, or returning from holiday
